intro: Mentzelia nuda var. integrifolia, commonly known as the naked mentzelia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Loasaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of yellow to orange flowers, which are typically tubular and arranged in dense inflorescences. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and open habitats. Mentzelia nuda var. integrifolia is adapted to withstand drought conditions and is often seen blooming in late spring to early summer.
